Key Match Events: Harry Brook and Liam Livingstone shared 78 runs in the final nine overs
Quinton de Kock top-scored with 65 runs
Jofra Archer took 3 wickets for 40 runs
Jos Buttler claimed a superb catch and run out
Aiden Markram caught Harry Brook to swing the game back in South Africa's favor
Post-Match Reflections: England captain Jos Buttler said, 'I'd say it was lost in the powerplay. Quinton de Kock came out and played with really good intent and we couldn't really match that.'

South Africa captain Aiden Markam said, 'Getting to those last three overs and it looks like the odds are against you, to hang in there and get the win shows a lot of skill, but it comes from a lot deeper than that. Fighting spirit really helped us today.'
England captain Jos Buttler added, 'At one stage we were favourites but T20 cricket is never that simple, and credit to South Africa for closing it out.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: South Africa beat England by seven runs to close on semi-finals
England finished on 156-6 in pursuit of 164
South Africa's Quinton de Kock led the way with the bat
David Miller backed up Quinton de Kock
South African supporters celebrated as eight did not go into one
